home.practiceModesSubtitle: Comprehensive preflop training covering all common scenarios.
home.ctaTitle: Ready to Level Up Your Game?

rfi.title: RFI Drill
rfi.description: Practice opening ranges from each position

vs3bet.title: VS 3-Bet Drill
vs3bet.description: Practice responding to 3-bets after you open raise

drill.chooseAction: Choose the correct action for this hand

pushFold.title: Push/Fold Drill
pushFold.description: Practice MTT short stack all-in decisions
pushFold.scenariosHint: Leave empty to include all scenarios
pushFold.referenceDesc: Push/Fold charts are based on Nash equilibrium ranges for tournament play. The correct decision depends on your stack size, position, and the action before you.

gtoPractice.title: GTO Practice Mode
gtoPractice.description: Practice preflop against a GTO AI opponent

tips.title: How to Play
tips.tip1: BTN vs BB heads-up preflop practice
tips.tip2: AI makes decisions based on GTO frequencies
tips.tip3: GTO advice shown after each hand
tips.tip4: Practice preflop strategy from different positions

range.title: Range Viewer
range.description: Explore GTO preflop ranges for 6-max cash games
range.selectPositionDesc: View the opening range (Raise First In) for each position
range.vsRfiDesc: You're in position, opponent opens, how do you respond
range.vs3betDesc: You opened, opponent 3-bets, how do you respond
range.vs4betDesc: You 3-bet, opponent 4-bets, how do you respond
range.openRangeDesc: RFI range when action folds to {position}
range.selectToView: Select a position to view the range

equity.title: Equity Quiz
equity.description: Test your knowledge of preflop hand equities
equity.question: What's the approximate all-in equity for these two hands?

tips.title: Common Equity Rules
tips.coinflip: Pair vs Two Overcards ≈ 55% vs 45% (classic coinflip)
tips.domination: Dominated hands (e.g., AK vs AQ) ≈ 70% vs 30%

outs.title: Outs Quiz
outs.description: Test your ability to count outs on the flop
outs.question: How many outs does this draw have?
outs.tipCombo: Combo draws subtract overlapping cards (e.g., flush + straight)

ev.title: EV Quiz
ev.description: Test your pot odds and expected value calculations
ev.questionPotOdds: What equity do you need to call?
ev.questionEV: What is the EV of calling?
ev.questionImplied: Considering implied odds, should you call or fold?
ev.tipPotOdds: Pot Odds = Call Amount ÷ (Pot + Villain Bet + Call Amount)
ev.tipImplied: Implied odds consider chips you may win in future streets
ev.explainPotOdds: Calling {bet} into a pot of {total}, need {bet}/{total} = {result}% equity
ev.explainImplied: With deep stacks and strong draws, implied odds can make up for insufficient direct odds

logic.title: GTO Logic Quiz
logic.description: Test your understanding of GTO principles

exploit.title: Exploit Quiz
exploit.description: Learn to adjust GTO strategy based on opponent types
exploit.tip1: 1. Calling Stations: Never bluff, always value bet bigger
exploit.tip2: 2. Nits: Fold marginal hands to their aggression, steal more
exploit.tip3: 3. Aggro Fish: Trap with strong hands, reduce bluffs
exploit.tip4: 4. High Rake: Tighten ranges, avoid marginal spots

postflop.title: Postflop Street Practice
postflop.description: Practice GTO strategies for Flop C-bet, Turn Barrel, and River Decisions

cbet.title: Postflop C-bet Practice
cbet.description: Practice making correct C-bet decisions on different board textures
cbet.question: What's your play?
cbet.tip1: Dry boards (like A72r) are good for high-frequency small c-bets due to range advantage.
cbet.tip2: Wet boards (like JT9ss) require more caution - opponents have more strong hands and draws.
cbet.tip3: Consider your hand's equity and playability on this specific board.

turn.tip1: Turn continuation bets should consider range changes from flop action
turn.tip2: Good turn cards are usually high cards or cards that complete your draws
turn.tip3: Pot control checks are sometimes better than forcing barrels

river.tip1: River is the final decision point - no more improvement opportunities
river.tip2: Consider opponent's range: what hands call? what hands fold?
river.tip3: Blocker effects are crucial for river bluff decisions

pushFold.title: MTT Push/Fold Charts
pushFold.description: Nash equilibrium push/fold ranges for short-stacked MTT play
pushFold.pushDesc: Hands to shove all-in when short-stacked
pushFold.defenseDesc: Hands to call when facing an all-in
pushFold.huDesc: Heads up push/fold ranges for final table and HU situations
pushFold.tip1: The shorter your stack, the wider you should push. At 3bb, shove almost any two cards.
pushFold.tip2: Later positions can push wider. BTN and SB are prime stealing spots.
pushFold.tip3: Consider pot odds when defending. BB should call wide vs SB shove.

icm.title: ICM Calculator
icm.description: Calculate real chip values in tournament scenarios
icm.tip1: ICM considers tournament payout structure - chip value is non-linear.
icm.tip2: Big stacks have diminishing marginal value, small stacks have high survival value.
icm.tip3: ICM pressure is highest near the bubble and at final tables.

analyze.title: Hand History Analysis
analyze.description: Upload your hand history to analyze preflop GTO leaks
analyze.uploadDesc: Select a GGPoker hand history file to analyze
analyze.dropOrClick: Drop file here or click to upload
analyze.instruction1: 1. Download your hand history from GGPoker
